author: Kolton Bloom
title: 2023 Evergreen State Fair Recap
description: The Evergreen State Fair has now wrapped up. I was there during the 4-H week like last year but this year I also stayed for the open show week. Unfortunately, I did not record placings during the 4-H week but I did record them during the open show week so here they are in order by age:
Additional congratulations to My Enchated Acres for taking Best of Breed for Nubians and to Leisure Time for taking Best of Breed for Nigerian Dwarfs, Best in Show, and Best Dairy Herd
Stay tuned for the upcoming breeding schedule

author: Kolton Bloom
title: Stanwood-Camano Fair!
description: Just got back from the Stanwood-Camano fair and resting up to head over to
tomorrow to go to the Clark County Fair to help show
The show went well,
was the reserve grand champion junior doe, which was very exciting.
and
also did very good.
I am looking forward to come back again next year!

author: Kolton Bloom
title: Road From Nationals
description: With Nationals over, I am now siting here writing this on our way back to Oregon for our yearly camping trip. This was my first time going to Nationals and it was a great experience. I started off on Saturday with Junior Judging and Junior management, of which I made the younger class by 13 days. I did much better than I expected, taking 4th place for judging and 7th place for management. Sunday began with showmanship but I didn't make the cut due to an improper manuever that I later asked some judges about and learned a couple different situations and what to do, so that was a great learning experience. My showmanship doe,
did an amazing job, thank you
from

for letting me borrow such a phenomenal doe. Sunday afternoon, I participated in groom squad with a group I had just met, we did much better than I thought, and despite not making the top 5, we were able to completely clip a goat in just 30 minutes!
Monday afternoon and Tuesday morning, I helped
Show Nubians, they did very well and at the end, one of her recently deceased bucks won premier sire, which was amazing
Tuesday afternoon and Wednesday morning, I helped
from

show her Nigerian Dwarf Goats. Unfortunately, they did not place very well due to the fact that she has very dairy, long goats, and the judge preferred the short-legged, short-necked fat goats. I'm not saying there weren't some nice does out there, but they all needed to lose a solid 5 to 10 pounds. Their was also up to 85 goats per class, so when only 20 goats can make the cut, it is very difficult to make it. We did however, make the cut in the four-year-old class, taking 6th place. I'd also like to say congratulations to
, another local farm, for making the cut with two animals in that class.
In the end, it was a great learning experience that I am glad for.

author: Kolton Bloom
title: My Little Helpers
description: After a busy week at Nationals, I came back home to my animals to find pens much in need of cleaning. The little wethers were so eager to help that they "Hopped right in", I am looking forward to how they will bond with their future owners. If you are interested, please check out the
page

author: Karen Bloom
title: Bottle Babies For Sale!
description: Bottle babies looking for a new family to love ❤️ Nigerian Dwarf wethers and an adult doe. Very friendly, would make great pets or brush mowers. North of Lake Stevens.
